name: Bagrati Cathedral
description: 11th-century UNESCO-listed hilltop cathedral with panoramic city views

name: Gelati Monastery
description: 12th-century monastic complex with stunning mosaics and frescoes

name: Motsameta Monastery
description: Clifftop twin churches overlooking the Tskaltsitela Gorge

name: Kutaisi Central Market
description: Bustling bazaar of fresh produce, spices, and local crafts

name: Colchis Fountain
description: Golden sculpture celebrating ancient Colchis mythology in town square

name: Kutaisi State Historical Museum
description: Exhibits of regional archaeology, ethnography, and art

name: Ancient Bathhouse
description: Ruins of medieval bath complex near Colchis Fountain

name: Prometheus Cave
description: Underground grotto with dramatic stalactites, lakes, and light show

name: Okatse Canyon & Skywalk
description: Dramatic gorge with cliff-edge walkway and waterfalls (day trip)

name: Martvili Canyon Boat Tour
description: Guided boat ride through emerald waters and limestone cliffs

name: Kutaisi Botanical Garden
description: Green oasis with ornamental plants and walking paths

name: Kutaisi Zoo
description: Small zoo featuring local wildlife and children’s playground

name: Colchis Folklore Evening
description: Traditional music and dance performance at local theater

name: Laghami Thermal Springs
description: Natural hot springs complex just outside Kutaisi

name: Kutaisi Street Food Tour
description: Taste local specialties: khachapuri, churchkhela, and fresh pomegranates

name: Mandili Café
description: Cozy spot for Georgian pastries and aromatic coffee

name: Ali & Nino Sculpture
description: Moving metal figures symbolizing eternal love on the Rioni embankment

name: Rioni River Promenade
description: Scenic riverside path with benches and skyline views

name: Colchis Mall
description: Modern shopping center with boutiques and food court

name: City Highlights Minibus Tour
description: Half-day guided loop of main sights and photo stops

name: Georgian Craft Workshop
description: Learn to weave traditional carpets or make enamel jewelry

name: Colchis Winery Tasting
description: Sample regional wines and learn qvevri fermentation techniques

name: Garden of Plants Café
description: Riverside terrace serving farm-to-table Georgian dishes

name: Kutaisi Pub Crawl
description: Visit top bars and meet locals over homemade chacha

name: Orange Bridge
description: Artistic pedestrian bridge with vibrant painted arches

name: Georgian Dance Class
description: Brief lesson in fast-paced folk dance steps

name: Cinema City Kutaisi
description: Modern multiplex showing Georgian and international films

name: Soviet Era Walking Tour
description: Explore Brutalist buildings and WWII monuments

name: Rioni River Rafting
description: White-water rafting excursion downstream of the city

name: Utsnobi Hill
description: Local hill with a small church and lookout point

name: Century-Old Bazaar Lane
description: Narrow alley of textile and spice stalls, still family-run

name: Kutaisi Central Library
description: Historic reading room with Soviet-era architecture

name: King David Statue
description: Monument to the medieval Georgian king in Independence Square

name: Kutaisi Night Photography Tour
description: Capture illuminated monuments with a local photographer

name: Children’s City Park
description: Playgrounds, mini-zoo, and seasonal amusement rides

name: Colchis Floating Bridge
description: Pontoon walkway across the Rioni River

name: Kutaisi Ghost Stories Walk
description: Evening legends of haunted monasteries and bridges

name: Black Lion Craft Brewery
description: Local microbrewery offering Georgian-style ales

name: Polyphonic Folk Music Night
description: Live concert of traditional Georgian singing

name: Georgian Cooking Academy
description: Full-day masterclass: dumplings, khinkali, and sauces

name: City Bike Share
description: Rental bikes for self-guided urban exploration

name: Kutaisi Contemporary Art Gallery
description: Rotating exhibitions of Georgian painters and sculptors
